events.event_description: The Gemini solar facility in Nevada, expected to be the largest solar project in the US, plans to begin operating with 690 MW of photovoltaic capacity and 380 MW of battery storage.
events.citation: Outside of these states, the Gemini solar facility in Nevada plans to begin operating in 2024. With a planned photovoltaic capacity of 690 megawatts (MW) and battery storage of 380 MW, it is expected to be the largest solar project in the United States when fully operational.

events.event_description: The Menifee Power Bank (460.0 MW) is scheduled to come online at the former Inland Empire Energy Center natural gas plant site in Riverside, California.
events.citation: Developers have scheduled the Menifee Power Bank (460.0 MW) at the site of the former Inland Empire Energy Center natural gas-fired power plant in Riverside, California, to come on line in 2024.

events.event_description: Two major offshore wind plants, Vineyard Wind 1 (800-MW) and South Fork Wind (130-MW), are scheduled to begin operations.
events.citation: Two large offshore wind plants scheduled to come on line this year are the 800-MW Vineyard Wind 1 off the coast of Massachusetts and the 130-MW South Fork Wind off the coast of New York. South Fork Wind, which developers expected to begin commercial operation last year, is now scheduled to come on line in March 2024.

events.event_description: The fourth reactor (1.1 GW) at Georgia's Vogtle nuclear power plant is scheduled to start up.
events.citation: Start-up of the fourth reactor (1.1 GW) at Georgia's Vogtle nuclear power plant, originally scheduled for last year, has moved to March 2024.

events.event_description: Vogtle Unit 3 began commercial operation at the nuclear power plant.
events.citation: Vogtle Unit 3 began commercial operation at the end of July last year.
